articles.headline: As Boeing Goes, So Goes the Stock Market
articles.snippet: The venerable aircraft maker is the Dow’s top performer this year, buoyed by its own execution and forces beyond its control.
articles.abstract: The venerable aircraft maker is the Dow’s top performer this year, buoyed by its own execution and forces beyond its control.
articles.lead_paragraph: Move over, FANG stocks — the listings powered by Facebook, Apple, Netflix and Google. Here’s a one-word explanation for why the Dow Jones industrial average and Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index hit a new high on Monday despite geopolitical tensions, turmoil in the White House and the threat of higher interest rates:

articles.headline: Seeing Hope for Flagging Economy, West Virginia Revamps Vocational Track
articles.snippet: Nearly two in five high school students now take vocational classes, including simulated workplaces designed to prepare them for good-paying jobs.
articles.abstract: Nearly two in five high school students now take vocational classes, including simulated workplaces designed to prepare them for good-paying jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. — In a sleek laboratory at Marshall University last month, four high school teachers hunched over a miniature steam-electric boiler, a tabletop replica of the gigantic machinery found in power plants.

articles.headline: Trump Doubles Down on Threats Against North Korea as Nuclear Tensions Escalate
articles.snippet: The president said that perhaps his earlier “fire and fury” comment was not strong enough, though he did say he was open to negotiations with the North Koreans.
articles.abstract: The president said that perhaps his earlier “fire and fury” comment was not strong enough, though he did say he was open to negotiations with the North Koreans.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRIDGEWATER, N.J. — President Trump escalated his war of words with North Korea on Thursday by declaring that his provocative threat to rain down “fire and fury” might not have been harsh enough, as nuclear tensions between the two nations continued to crackle.

articles.headline: Deepening Rift, Trump Won’t Say if Mitch McConnell Should Step Down
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump has trained his fire on Mr. McConnell, the Senate majority leader, for days, venting on Twitter about the Senate’s inability to pass a health care bill.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump has trained his fire on Mr. McConnell, the Senate majority leader, for days, venting on Twitter about the Senate’s inability to pass a health care bill.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Thursday sharply amplified his criticism of the Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, raising the possibility that Mr. McConnell should relinquish his position if he cannot deliver on top legislative priorities.

articles.headline: Uber Investor Sues Travis Kalanick for Fraud
articles.snippet: Benchmark, the venture capital firm that is one of Uber’s biggest investors, sued Mr. Kalanick in an attempt to remove him from the ride-hailing company’s board.
articles.abstract: Benchmark, the venture capital firm that is one of Uber’s biggest investors, sued Mr. Kalanick in an attempt to remove him from the ride-hailing company’s board.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Travis Kalanick, who built Uber into a transportation behemoth, was ousted as chief executive of the ride-hailing company in June by unhappy investors. Now, one of those investors has escalated the battle by suing Mr. Kalanick, claiming fraud and other transgressions, in an attempt to remove him from Uber’s board of directors.

articles.headline: Forget Ratings. ‘Orphan Black’ Had the #CloneClub.
articles.snippet: The BBC America show, which ends its five-season run on Saturday, found success by engaging with and empowering its small but dedicated fan base online.
articles.abstract: The BBC America show, which ends its five-season run on Saturday, found success by engaging with and empowering its small but dedicated fan base online.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Orphan Black” never had huge ratings. A July episode on BBC America, for example, garnered just 645,000 viewers, ranking it 33rd among scripted cable TV series that week.

articles.headline: Meet Kim Jong-un, a Moody Young Man With a Nuclear Arsenal
articles.snippet: Once dismissed as a figurehead, North Korea’s young leader has used purges and crafty moves to exert firm control over his country and its expanding nuclear arsenal.
articles.abstract: Once dismissed as a figurehead, North Korea’s young leader has used purges and crafty moves to exert firm control over his country and its expanding nuclear arsenal.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — In China, the man threatening to fire missiles at the United States is often derided as a chubby brat. In the United States, a senator recently referred to him as “this crazy fat kid.” President Trump once called him “a total nut job.”

articles.headline: Even the Most Precise Strike on North Korea Could Prompt Retaliation
articles.snippet: A limited U.S. action, like knocking out a missile before it launches, could set off a spiral of escalation.
articles.abstract: A limited U.S. action, like knocking out a missile before it launches, could set off a spiral of escalation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — North Korea’s threat on Thursday to test-fire ballistic missiles soon near the American territory of Guam deepened the challenge confronting the Trump administration: how to defang Pyongyang’s missile programs without risking all-out war.
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: England Bans Betting in Soccer, but Not for ‘The Lizard’
articles.snippet: The F.A. told The New York Times it has unpublished rules for people like Tony Bloom, owner of Brighton & Hove Albion, who have gambling interests.
articles.abstract: The F.A. told The New York Times it has unpublished rules for people like Tony Bloom, owner of Brighton & Hove Albion, who have gambling interests.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — They call Tony Bloom “The Lizard” in poker circles. But the Lizard is more than just a gambler.

articles.headline: Investing Short-Term When Stocks Are High? Imagine a Painful Drop
articles.snippet: How much money should you have in stocks in your 529 or down payment account when stocks are so high? Ask yourself some tough questions to figure it out.
articles.abstract: How much money should you have in stocks in your 529 or down payment account when stocks are so high? Ask yourself some tough questions to figure it out.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every week brings a new worry, something or another that could finally, truly, end our eight-year-plus bull market in American stocks.

articles.headline: Trump Says Military Is ‘Locked and Loaded’ and North Korea Will ‘Regret’ Threats
articles.snippet: As he renewed his warning against Kim Jong-un, the North Korean leader, President Trump also suggested possible U.S. military action in Venezuela.
articles.abstract: As he renewed his warning against Kim Jong-un, the North Korean leader, President Trump also suggested possible U.S. military action in Venezuela.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRIDGEWATER, N.J. — President Trump continued to beat war drums on Friday against North Korea and, unexpectedly, said he would consider a military option to deal with an unrelated crisis in Venezuela. But though he declared that the armed forces were “locked and loaded,” there were no indications of imminent action in either part of the world.
